Detailed Description

The CTask class wraps a native FreeRTOS task handle (xTaskHandle). To create a task instance an object of this class and then call its CTask::Create method like showed in the following sample: 

 CTask g_aTask // global task declaration.

 void main()
 {
       g_aTask.Create(task_control_func, "Led2", configMINIMAL_STACK_SIZE, mainFLASH_TASK_PRIORITY);

       CFreeRTOS::StartScheduler();
 }

Usually the application subclass this class to create an application specific task object. See the CHelloWorld class for an example.

See also:
task documentation in the FreeRTOS web site.
Date:
Jul 5, 2010
Author:
Stefano Oliveri (STF12.net) E-Mail: software@stf12.net

Definition at line 36 of file CTask.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CTask::CTask ( )

The default constructor. It initializes the object without attaching it to a native FreeRTOS handle. Call the Create method to allocate a task handle and attach it to the object.

CTask.cpp

Created on: Jul 5, 2010 Author: Stefano Oliveri (STF12.net) E-Mail: software@stf12.net

Definition at line 312 of file CTask.h.

void CTask::Attach ( xGenericHandle  handle) [virtual]

Attach the object to a given FreeRTOS handle. A previous attached handle is deleted and its resource are freed.

Parameters:
handlespecifies a native FreeRTOS handle.

Implements IFreeRTOSObj.

Definition at line 60 of file CTask.cpp.

Referenced by Attach(), CMessageTask::Run(), and ~CTask().

xGenericHandle CTask::Detach ( ) [inline, virtual]

Usually a FreeRTOS handle is disposed and his resource freed when the attached object is deleted. Call this method to keep the handle alive.

Returns:
the native FreeRTOS handle. This handle is valid after the object is disposed.

Implements IFreeRTOSObj.

bool CTask::IsValid ( ) const [inline, virtual]

Check if the object is attached to a valid FreRTOS native handle.

Returns:
true if the is attached to a valid FreRTOS native handle, false otherwise.

Implements IFreeRTOSObj.
